category.term: 2361~Terra Nova (TV Show)~Community (TV Show)~FOX Broadcasting Company~Fringe (TV Show)
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
With the atrocities of the 2011/2012 pilot season all but forgotten (H8R, we hardly knew yee), a new crop of mid-season replacements and returning comedy favourites are finding their way onto the schedule (we missed you, Community!). But, as Terra Nova's recent cancellation attests, unless your show features four nerds and a hot female neighbour, no one is safe.

With that in mind, we're taking a look at the fate of our favourite shows. We've aggregated the opinions of TV pundits from Entertainment Weekly, E!Online, and TVLine (as well as our own gut) to predict what's coming back next season. We're playing bookies and placing our bets on each network show, ranking them "sure bets," "could go either way," or "wouldn't bet on it."

As always with TV, nothing is truly certain until the networks make official statements, and things can change on a dime (Terra Nova's sudden cancellation has left a giant, dinosaur-shaped hole in Fox's primetime schedule, giving the previously doomed Fringe new hope). We'll be updating frequently as new gossip arises. Be sure to check back often.

ABC

The Bachelor: A sure bet

The Bachelorette: A sure bet

Body of Proof: Could go either way

Castle: A sure bet

Charlie's Angels: Already cancelled

Cougar Town: Could go either way (but our gut says it's a goner)

Dancing With the Stars: A sure bet

Desperate Housewives: Already cancelled

Extreme Makeover: Home Edition: Already cancelled

GCB: Could go either way (but our gut says it's a goner)

Grey's Anatomy: A sure bet

Happy Endings: A sure bet

Last Man Standing: A sure bet

Man Up: Already cancelled

The Middle: A sure bet

Modern Family: A sure bet

Once Upon a Time: A sure bet

Pan Am: Wouldn't bet on it

Private Practice: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

Revenge: A sure bet

The River: Could go either way (but our gut says it's a goner)

Suburgatory: A sure bet

Work It: Already cancelled

CBS

2 Broke Girls: A sure bet

The Amazing Race: A sure bet

The Big Bang Theory: Already renewed

Blue Bloods: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

Criminal Minds: A sure bet

CSI: A safe bet. A sure bet

CSI: Miami: Could go either way

CSI: NY: Could go either way

A Gifted Man: Wouldn't bet on it

The Good Wife: A sure bet

Hawaii Five-0: A sure bet

How I Met Your Mother: Already renewed

How to Be a Gentleman: Already cancelled

The Mentalist: A sure bet

Mike & Molly: A sure bet

NCIS: A sure bet

NCIS: Los Angeles: A sure bet

Person of Interest: Could go either way

Rob: Could go either way

Rules of Engagement: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

Survivor: Already renewed

Two and a Half Men: A sure bet

Undercover Boss: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

Unforgettable: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

FOX

Alcatraz: Could go either way

Allen Gregory: Already cancelled

American Dad: Already renewed

American Idol: A sure bet

Bones: A sure bet

Breaking In: Could go either way

The Cleveland Show: Already renewed

Family Guy: A sure bet

The Finder: Wouldn't bet on it

Fringe: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

Glee: A sure bet

House: Already cancelled

I Hate My Teenage Daughter: Wouldn't bet on it

Kitchen Nightmares: Already renewed

Napoleon Dynamite: Could go either way (but our gut says it's a goner)

New Girl: A sure bet

Raising Hope: A sure bet

The Simpsons: Already renewed

Terra Nova: Already cancelled

Touch: Could go either way

The X Factor: Already renewed

NBC

30 Rock: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

Are You There, Chelsea?: Wouldn't bet on it

The Biggest Loser: A sure bet

Celebrity Apprentice: A sure bet

Chuck: Already cancelled

Community: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

Free Agents: Already cancelled

Grimm: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

Harry's Law: Could go either way (but our gut says it's a goner)

Law & Order: SVU: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

The Office: A sure bet

Parenthood: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

Parks and Recreation: A sure bet

The Playboy Club: Already cancelled

Prime Suspect: Already cancelled

Smash: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

The Firm: Wouldn't bet on it

Up All Night: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

The Voice: A sure bet

Whitney: Wouldn't bet on it

THE CW

90210: Wouldn't bet on it

America's Next Top Model: A sure bet

Gossip Girl: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

H8R: Already cancelled

Hart of Dixie: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

Nikita: Could go either way (but our gut says it's a goner)

One Tree Hill: Already cancelled

Remodeled: Wouldn't bet on it

Ringer: Could go either way (but our gut says it's a goner)

The Secret Circle: Could go either way (but our gut says it's safe)

Supernatural: A sure bet

The Vampire Diaries: A sure bet

link.Abstract: Yvette Nicole Brown (L) and creator/executive producer Dan Harmon attend The Paley Center For Media's PaleyFest 2012 Honoring Community.

link.Abstract: A sneak peek at the Greendale gang's comeback episode, "Urban Matrimony and the Sandwich Arts."

link.Abstract: According to creator Dan Harmon, the show will return to its 8 p.m. ET slot on NBC's Thursday night comedy lineup beginning March 15.
link.title: Community Set to Return to NBC's Lineup March 15

link.Abstract: In the newly released clip, the Community star meets a cactus, a pineapple and a porcupine, and explains what makes them extra sharp.
link.title: Watch Joel McHale Explain 'Prickly' on Sesame Street

link.Abstract: Today at the TCA1012: NBC!
link.title: #TCA12: Community Coming Back, Alec Baldwin Signs On For Two More Season of 30 Rock and More!

link.Abstract: The epic battle pitted Team Karate Dog – Donald Glover, Gillian Jacobs, Joel McHale and Jim Rash – against the Hilarious Hive On Jive featuring Eldridge Cleaver – Chevy Chase, Alison Brie, Yvette Nicole Brown and Danny Pudi – for table dancing rights
link.title: Watch the Cast of Community Play Pop Culture Trivial Pursuit (For the Last Time?)

entry.title: The Best and Worst Series Finales

link.Abstract: When TV shows go off the air for good, sometimes their goodbyes are sweet and sometimes they're sour.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Best: Arrested Development -- Critical praise, a devoted fan base and brilliant writing weren't enough to save this beloved sitcom from the Fox executives, but Mitch Hurwitz and the writers figured out a perfect send-off. Lucille Bluth's manipulative ways were finally revealed, Tobias and Lindsay stayed together (albeit with several sexy sailors between them), and while Maeby turned out not to be related to George Michael, father Michael told him that they're still family and it's time to move on. And move on they did -- they stole a boat and left their family behind. Well, until the movie finally gets made. Hurry up and film it, Mitch!
link.title: 091109_sf_arrested.jpg

link.Abstract: We look at television plots that left us wondering what happened next.
link.title: TV's Worst Unresolved Storylines
